alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 02 at 4:22AM CDT until April 05 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Rock Island, Henry IL and Whiteside Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Water affects some summer cottages along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 12.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued later this morning.
